Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*Restrictions in response to coronavirus: Flight restrictions from Europe have been lifted. Passengers arriving from all countries require a PCR test taken up to 72 hours before flying and is required for everybody over 5-years of age to enter Bolivia. On arrival you must quarantine for 10 days, and pay for a PCR test on the 7th day of quarantine. Tourists must show proof of medical insurance that will cover the cost of COVID treatment.
You should arrange to take a private test.
You should check specific requirements with your airline. The border with Brazil is temporarily closed. Other land, river and lake border crossings have been opened by Bolivian authorities, but Paraguay is the only neighbouring country that has opened its borders so far.

Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Bolivia: As of January 1 2022 vaccination certificates, or negative PCR test taken within 48 hours will be required to enter any public building including banks, supermarkets, cinemas, bars, and internal flights and bus journeys.
The following quarantine measures apply nationally: Schools are gradually opening. In public places you must maintain 1.5m distance from other people and use facemasks, including outside.
As of January 1 vaccination certificates or a negative PCR test within the last 48 hours will be required for internal flights and bus journeys in Bolivia.
